openings.name: Sicilian Defense
explanation: Black immediately fights for the center with a flank pawn
Creates imbalanced positions with many tactical opportunities

variations.name: Closed Sicilian
variations.explanation: White aims for a slower, more positional game

variations.name: Open Sicilian
variations.explanation: White immediately opens the center for tactical play

openings.name: Ruy Lopez
explanation: One of the oldest and most popular openings
White pins the knight and prepares to control the center
Creates long-term pressure on Black's position

variations.name: Berlin Defense
variations.explanation: A solid defense favored by many top players

variations.name: Morphy Defense
variations.explanation: The most popular response, keeping the bishop pair
